07/02/09~~~food for thought~~~What do these words mean to you: "Christ-like"

Our Bible Verse for Today:
This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down
His life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for our 
brothers. (Christian brothers and sisters)...(I Jn. 3:16)

Our Lesson for Today:
"Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life
for his friend." Here our Lord reveals to us the inconceivable love
that moved Him to die for us...

And now under the influence and in the power of that love dwelling
in us comes the message: 

"We ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters."

Nothing less is expected of us than a Christ-like life and a Christ-like
love proving itself in all our fellowship with believers...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord as we live daily in You, may we learn to lay down our lives
for one another as Christ did for us...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Nothing less is expected of us than a Christ-like life and a Christ-like love proving itself in all our fellowship with believers.

May we be filled with that same selfless love, willing to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters as He did for us. Grant us the strength and courage to love one another as You have loved us, that the world may see Your light shining through our lives. In the name of our Savior, we pray. Amen.

07/04/09~~~food for thought~~~True "Independence" (below)

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"If the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed." (Jn. 8:36)

Because through Christ Jesus the law of the Spirit of life, 
set me free from the law of sin and death...(Ro. 8:2)

It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. 'Stand firm,' then,
and do not let yourselves be burden again by a yoke of slavery...
(Gal. 5:1)

Our Lesson for Today:
Christ died to set us free from sin and from a long list of laws 
and regulations. 'Yes ~ Christ came to set us free ~ not free 
to do whatever we want because that would lead us back into
slavery to our selfish desires...

But, thanks to Christ, we are now free and able to do what was 
impossible before ~ to live unselfishly.

Those who appeal to their freedom so they can have their own
way or indulge their own desires are falling back into sin. But
it is also wrong to put a burden of law keeping on Christians...

We must stand against those who would enslave us with rules
methods, or special conditions for being saved or growing in 
Christ...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Lord, for True Freedom, lead us in the truth...

Have a safe and happy 4th
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

the cross, and we must put on the new nature...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, 
through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the 
world...(Gal 6:14)

Our Lesson for Today:
I think that it goes without saying, if we stop and think,
'that the world is full of enticements...

Each and every day we are confronted with subtle pressures.
The only way to escape these destructive influences is to ask
God to help crucify our interest in them, just as Paul did...

Let me pose this question to you ~ How much do the interest of 
this world matter to you???

For more on this concept look up (Gal. 2:20 & 5:24)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the blessing of the cross,
for it teaches me the worthlessness of my own efforts and the
complete corruption of my own nature...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/06/09~~~food for thought~~~Jesus will never leave us...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"And surely I am with you always to the
very end of the age." (Mt. 28:20b)

Our Lesson for Today:
So deep was the disciples consciousness of His presence,
that when Christ spoke of His leaving them to go to the Father,
their hearts were filled with deep sorrow...

The presence of Christ had become indispensable to them;
they could not think of living without Him... 

To comfort them, Christ gave them the promise of the Holy Spirit 
with the assurance that they then would have Himself in His heavenly 
presence in a sense far deeper and more intimate than they had ever 
known on earth...

The law of their first vocation remained unchanged: to be with Him,
to live in unbroken fellowship with Him would be the secret of power
to preach and to testify of Him...

Remember, it is by His Holy Spirit's presence that we receive the power
to witness of His love for all people...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for Your abiding presence,
for the freshness and the power of the heavenly life...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/07/09~~~food for thought~~~It is not our ability ~ but our availability that
God wants to use...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus came and told His disciples, "I have been given
complete authority in heaven and on earth." (Mt. 28:18)

Our Lesson for Today:
God gave Jesus authority over heaven and earth...

On the basis of that authority, Jesus told His disciples to make
more disciples as they preached, baptized, and taught...

With this same authority, Jesus still commands us to tell others
the Good News and make them disciples for the Kingdom...

Let us remember, that this power is never meant to be experienced
as if it were our own...

It is only as Jesus Christ as a living Person dwells and works with 
His divine energy in our own heart and life that there can be power
in our preaching and personal testimony...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I pray that I would be sensitive, to Your calling to 
every believer, to contribute in some small way to share the Word.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/08/09~~~food for thought~~~If God takes you to it,
He will bring you through it...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
God assured Moses that:
"I will be with you." (Ex. 3:12a)

Lesson for Today:
How often, when we are asked to do something, do we act like
Moses and make excuses???

Moses made excuses because he felt inadequate for the job
God gave him to do...

Now it was quiet natural for him to feel that way. He was inadequate 
by himself. BUT God wasn't asking him to work alone...

He offered Moses other resources to help (God himself, Aaron,
and the ability to do miracles).

God often calls us to do tasks that seem to difficult, but He doesn't
ask us to do them alone. God also offers us His resources, just as
He did to Moses...

We should not hide behind our inadequacies, as Moses did, but look
behind ourselves to the great resources available. Then we can allow 
God to use our unique contributions...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Lord, for the reassuring words, 
"I am with you always."

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/09/09~~~food for thought~~~Always give Him the praise that is due Him...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
This is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world (Jn. 4:42)

Our Lesson for Today:
Omnipotence and Omnipresence are what are called the natural attributes
of God. They have their true worth only ~ only when linked to and inspired
by His moral attributes, holiness and love...

When our Lord spoke of the omnipotence having been given Him
'all power on earth and in heaven' and the omnipresence 'His presence
with each of His disciples' His words pointed to all that which lies at
the root of all ~ His divine glory as the Savior of the world and Redeemer
of men...

It was because He humbled Himself and became obedient to death,
the death of the Cross, that God so highly exalted Him. His share as
the man Christ Jesus in the attributes of God was owing to the work He 
had done in His perfect obedience to the will of God and the finished 
redemption He had brought forth for the salvation of the world...

Yes, it is Jesus Christ who saves His people from their sins, who rules
over a people willing in the day of His power and proves in them that He
enables them to say, "I delight to do Thy will, O my God," who says,
"Lo, I am with you always."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, You are the Savior of the world and
Redeemer of men. Help us to hear and obey Your command
to go into all the world and preach the Gospel and obey
all that You have commanded...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

07/10/09~~~food for thought~~~Let us no longer live for the flesh,
but for Christ crucified...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of
our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world hath
been crucified unto me, and I unto the world." (Gal 6:14)

Our Lesson for Today:
When Jesus said to His disciples, "Lo, I am with you always,"
It was as the Crucified One, who had shown them His hands 
and His feet, that gave the promise...

And to each one of us who seek to claim the promise, it is of
the first importance that we should realize: it is the crucified 
Jesus who promises, who offers, to be with us every day...

May not this be one reason why we find it so difficult to
expect and enjoy the abiding presence? ~ because we do not glory 
in the Cross by which we are crucified with Him." 

They that are Christ's have crucified the flesh with its affections and 
lusts ~ and yet how little we have learned that the world has been 
crucified to us and that we are free from its power...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, help us to learn the lesson, that it is You
the crucified Christ, who comes to walk with us every day,
and in whose power we too are to live can say: "I have
been crucified with Christ," "Christ crucified lives in me."

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/20/09~~~food for thought~~~The indwelling of Christ is the secret to a life of faith...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Paul says' "But when God, who set me apart from birth and
called me by His grace, was pleased ~ to reveal His Son to
me that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not 
consult any man ~ (Gal. 1:15-16)

Our Lesson for Today:
Because God was guiding Paul's ministry, Paul wasn't doing
anything that God hadn't already planned and given him power
to do...

Similarly God appointed Jeremiah to be His spokesman before
Jeremiah was born (Jer. 1:5)...

God knows each of us intimately as well ~ and He chose each of
us to be His before we were born (see Ps. 139). He wants us to
draw close to Him and to fulfill the purpose He has for our life...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to always believe in the abiding presence
of Christ as the sure gift to each one who trusts in Him fully...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/27/09~~~food for thought~~~The "secret plan" is Christ's 
Good News of salvation...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Devote yourself to prayer with an alert mind and 
a thankful heart...(Col. 4:2)

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you ever grown tired of praying for someone or something?

In our Bible verse today Paul says we should "devote" ourselves
to prayer and be "alert" in prayer...

Our persistence is an expression of our faith that God answers our
prayers. Faith shouldn't die if the answers come slowly, because
the delay may be God's way of working His will in our life...

When you feel tired of praying, remember God said, "I will never
leave you or forsake you." 

So by this we know that God is present, always listening, always answering, 
maybe not in the ways you had hoped for, but in ways that He knows is best...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, come and live in my heart today.
Help me to be sensitive to Your presence...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
